meta.notes: 7-day plans generated from onboarding survey. Templates selected by conditions; one template picked deterministically per user+week (seed in PracticePlanService).

days.title: Day 1 — Downshift & Decompress
days.description: Tonight is about lowering the volume. Do 4 minutes of slow breathing (inhale 4, exhale 6), then a short body scan. End by dimming screens 30 minutes earlier and preparing tomorrow’s morning as a kindness-to-yourself ritual.

days.title: Day 2 — Sleep Anchors
days.description: Create two anchors: a fixed wake time and a 10-minute wind-down. Practice a gentle ‘counting breaths’ meditation. If thoughts race, label them (‘planning’, ‘worry’) and return to the breath without fighting them.

days.title: Day 3 — Nervous System Safety
days.description: Try a calming practice: 5 minutes of breathing + 5 minutes of progressive muscle relaxation. Choose one small evening habit (warm shower, herbal tea, reading) and repeat it consistently.

days.title: Day 4 — Stress-to-Sleep Bridge
days.description: Do a short ‘worry dump’ on paper for 3 minutes, then close it. Follow with a soothing guided body scan. Finish by making your bedroom slightly cooler and darker (sleep environment matters more than we think).

days.title: Day 5 — Micro-Recovery During the Day
days.description: Build daytime recovery: 3 micro-pauses (60 seconds) where you relax shoulders and slow the breath. Evening practice: a soft attention meditation—notice sounds, then return to breath.

days.title: Day 6 — Gentle Consistency
days.description: Repeat what worked best so far. Add a short gratitude reflection (3 items) to redirect the brain from threat-scanning to safety cues. Keep it simple—sleep improves with consistency, not intensity.

days.title: Day 7 — Your Personal Sleep Protocol
days.description: Combine your top 2 calming tools into a repeatable 15-minute routine. Write a one-sentence commitment: ‘This week I protect my sleep by…’. You’re building a system, not chasing perfect nights.

days.title: Day 1 — Calm the Alarm
days.description: Start with 2 minutes of slow exhale breathing. Then do a basic mindfulness practice: notice breath, notice thoughts, return. Aim for ‘kind repetition’ instead of ‘perfect focus’.

days.title: Day 2 — Name It to Tame It
days.description: Practice labeling: when anxiety shows up, silently name it (‘anxiety’, ‘worry’, ‘tension’). Then return to one physical anchor: breath, feet on floor, or hands.

days.title: Day 3 — Expand Your Window
days.description: Try a short grounding cycle: 5 senses scan + 5 slow breaths. Add one small exposure to avoidance (e.g., sending that message) and reward yourself afterwards.

days.title: Day 4 — Thought Distance
days.description: Learn cognitive defusion: ‘I’m having the thought that…’. Use it for 3 recurring worries. Finish with 2 minutes of compassionate self-talk like you would speak to a friend.

days.title: Day 5 — Breath + Body
days.description: Do a body scan, but gently. When you hit tension, soften 10%. You’re training the nervous system to downshift—not forcing relaxation.

days.title: Day 6 — Your Coping Stack
days.description: Build a ‘coping stack’: 1) breathe 60s, 2) name emotion, 3) choose one next action. Practice it once when you’re calm, so it’s available when you’re stressed.

days.title: Day 7 — Make Calm Repeatable
days.description: Review what helped most (breathing, labeling, grounding). Choose one 5-minute daily habit to keep. The goal is reliability, not intensity.

days.title: Day 1 — One-Task Mind
days.description: Practice 8 minutes of focused attention on breath. Then do a 4-minute ‘single-task sprint’: one small task with all distractions off.

days.title: Day 2 — Attention Training
days.description: Try ‘counting breaths’ up to 10, then restart. If you lose count, restart gently. Afterwards, write your top 3 priorities for tomorrow.

days.title: Day 3 — Reduce Mental Tabs
days.description: Do a short open awareness practice—notice sounds/thoughts without chasing them. Then close 2 open loops: one message, one small pending task.

days.title: Day 4 — Deep Work Ritual
days.description: Before work: 2 minutes breathing + one sentence intention (‘Today I focus on…’). Then 20 minutes deep work (Pomodoro).

days.title: Day 5 — Focus Recovery
days.description: Add a micro-walk or stretch between tasks. Practice attention reset: 5 slow breaths while relaxing jaw/shoulders.

days.title: Day 6 — Distraction Audit
days.description: Notice your top distraction pattern (phone, tabs, procrastination). Choose one rule: ‘phone in another room’, ‘single tab’, or ‘timer first’. Practice a short meditation afterwards.

days.title: Day 7 — Sustainable Focus Plan
days.description: Combine: 10 minutes meditation + a simple daily focus routine (intention + 1 deep work block). Make it repeatable and realistic.

days.title: Day 1 — Reset the Body
days.description: Do 10 minutes body scan + 5 minutes slow breathing. Add one small boundary today: reduce one optional commitment or say ‘not today’ once.

days.title: Day 2 — Stress Signals
days.description: Identify 3 personal stress signals (tight chest, fast thoughts, irritability). When you notice them, do a 90-second pause: exhale longer than inhale.

days.title: Day 3 — Recovery Blocks
days.description: Schedule one 15-minute recovery block (walk, stretch, quiet). Evening: calming breathwork + minimal screens.

days.title: Day 4 — Emotional Regulation
days.description: Practice ‘RAIN’ briefly: Recognize, Allow, Investigate, Nurture. Use it on one recurring worry. Keep it gentle and practical.

days.title: Day 5 — Sleep Protection
days.description: Shift caffeine earlier (if relevant) and do a 10-minute wind-down routine. Meditation: soft attention on breath + body.

days.title: Day 6 — Choice Point
days.description: Ask: ‘What choice reduces stress 5% today?’ Pick one micro-action. Meditation: open awareness, observe thoughts like clouds.

days.title: Day 7 — Your Stress System
days.description: Write your personal ‘stress system’: triggers, signals, and 3 best tools. Decide your default daily practice for next week.

days.title: Day 1 — Precision Attention
days.description: Focused attention with clear counting, then switch to open awareness. End with a short intention practice: align behavior with values for the day.

days.title: Day 2 — Equanimity Practice
days.description: Observe sensations and thoughts without preference. Train balanced attention: ‘pleasant, unpleasant, neutral’ labels—then release.

days.title: Day 3 — Compassion Expansion
days.description: Metta practice: self → friend → neutral → difficult → all beings. Keep it grounded and non-performative.

days.title: Day 4 — Deep Focus Block
days.description: Meditation first, then a single deep work block. Minimize novelty. Treat concentration as a skill you protect.

days.title: Day 5 — Subtle Body Awareness
days.description: Body scan at a subtler layer: temperature, vibration, micro-movements. End by relaxing effort: ‘do less’ in attention.

days.title: Day 6 — Integration Day
days.description: Bring mindfulness into routine actions: shower, eating, walking. Practice ‘noting’ in daily life without forcing it.

days.title: Day 7 — Design Your Next Week
days.description: Choose a theme (focus, compassion, equanimity). Create a sustainable schedule: duration, time, and fallback on busy days.

days.title: Day 1 — Start Small, Start Now
days.description: Short breath meditation. Keep it simple: notice, return, repeat. Add one tiny wellbeing action today (water, short walk, stretching).

days.title: Day 2 — Body & Breath
days.description: Body scan + calm breathing. Practice listening to the body without judgment. One practical goal: reduce one unnecessary stressor today.

days.title: Day 3 — Mindful Moments
days.description: Open awareness meditation. Add 3 mindful moments during the day: before eating, before opening social media, before sleep.

days.title: Day 4 — Focus & Clarity
days.description: Focused attention meditation. Pick one priority task and do it in a distraction-free 15–20 minute block.

days.title: Day 5 — Emotional Balance
days.description: Practice labeling emotions and softening tension. End with a short self-compassion phrase: ‘This is hard, and I’m doing my best.’

days.title: Day 6 — Recovery & Rest
days.description: Choose a restorative practice (slow breathing, body scan, or gentle stretching). Protect sleep by creating a brief wind-down routine.

days.title: Day 7 — Reflect & Continue
days.description: Review your week: what helped most? Choose a realistic default practice for next week and a backup plan for busy days.

days.title: Day 1 — Gentle Start
days.description: Breathing meditation + one small supportive action (hydration, short walk, early bedtime).

days.title: Day 2 — Mindful Awareness
days.description: Open awareness meditation. Notice thoughts and return to the present without judgment.

days.title: Day 3 — Body Scan Basics
days.description: Body scan from head to toe. Soften tension by 10% where you find it.

days.title: Day 4 — Focus Practice
days.description: Focused attention on breath. Keep it steady and kind.

days.title: Day 5 — Stress Release
days.description: Slow exhale breathing + gentle relaxation. Reduce one avoidable stressor today.

days.title: Day 6 — Rest & Restore
days.description: Choose a calming practice and protect a short wind-down window before sleep.

days.title: Day 7 — Plan Your Next Week
days.description: Pick a default practice time and a backup plan. Consistency beats intensity.
